text.0: A pensioner died from fatal injuries after being hit on the head by a cricket ball during a match. David Wilcockson, 71, was bowling at a ground in Cranleigh, Surrey when the batsman's shot struck him on the head. Players battled in vain to revive him after he slumped on the pitch unconscious and he was taken by air ambulance to King's College Hospital in London. text.1:
A pensioner died from fatal injuries after being hit onthe head while walking on the pavement in their local town.
The incident occurred around 7pm on Sunday, September 11th, and was reported to the local police.
According to the news report, the pensioner, a senior citizen, was walking down the main street of the town when they were hit by a car while crossing the road.
Emergency services rushed to the scene and treated the pensioner, who later died in the emergency room of the town's hospital.
